title: Animatronic Dinosaur
content:
Dinosaur Animation (Blender)

One of the requirements for this project was to have expressive animations. My task was to create a seamless workflow . I had prior experience modelling and rigging characters in Blender, so I applied it to this project through the following steps:

Export .fbx files of the mechanisms from CAD software (Fusion 360)
Import the entire model into Blender
Rigging: Align armature joints with those on the model
Add inverse kinematics and ring objects that control orientation of head, eyes, and tail
Export servo motor angles into C++ arrays using plugin

Using the software developed by other members of the team, this animation was able to be translated quickly into the actual model.
CAD (Fusion 360)

[!tip] Laser-Cut Body Frame Design

title: Desk Mount Phone Charger
content:
I designed, 3D printed and laser cut a working wireless phone charger, meeting the following requirements:

Holds my phone securely
Phone can easily be placed and removed
Charges my phone wirelessly
Minimises footprint on top of desk or other surfaces

The solution I came up with was a drawer that could slide out and hold the phone at a 45Â° angle, mounting under my desk to minimise footprint.

[!info] Desk Mount Phone Charger Assembly
